pullRequest.title: UX refinements for the Command Palette
pullRequest.bodyText:
This change rolls up a batch of improvements to the command palette's UX, variously suggested by our designer and team feedback.
Look and feel
The command palette's overall look has been tweaked based on feedback from our designer to look less like a dialog.

Match on context
Matching now occurs on the context label for palette entries, so you can type in e.g., setting to get a list of settings, or styler to see all the commands from the styler package.

Variable height
The palette now shrinks appropriately when there aren't many matches.

Clearer toggles
The toggle switches don't use our custom slider control any more as it's too difficult to read in this context. Instead, they use a plain checkbox with a clear "On" or "Off" designation. It doesn't look quite as pretty, but it's clearer and hopefully more accessible.

Clearer plugin designation
Commands that come from plugins (not native to RStudio) now have a custom icon indicating as such.
